akn:section.akn:heading: Oversight of Defense Intelligence Agency culture

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Findings Congress finds that the Defense Intelligence Agency has committed to improving Agency culture and leadership; however, actions taken by the Agency as of December 23, 2022, have not enabled a full assessment of the extent of workforce culture issues and potential management abuses, and require additional congressional oversight to ensure concerns are both understood and addressed.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Mandatory provision of exit survey or interview

akn:content.akn:p: (c) Mandatory provision of exit survey or interview

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Congressional oversight relating to workforce climate surveys

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Congressional oversight relating to workforce climate surveys

(e) Feasibility report Not later than 270 days after December 23, 2022, the Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report containing an analysis of the feasibility (including the anticipated cost, personnel requirements, necessary authorities, and such other matters as may be determined appropriate by the Director for purposes of analyzing feasibility) of—
